channel.title: Social Skills on Behaviorism and Mental Health
channel.description: Recent content in Social Skills on Behaviorism and Mental Health

item.title: Mental Health and the Schools
item.description: When I was about eleven or twelve, I had reasonably good social skills with my peers, but I was shy and awkward with adults. Our neighbor, Mrs. F., was a very pleasant lady who loved to spend time in her front yard with her flowers.  Often, as I came up the walk to our door, I would pass her.  She always gave me a nice greeting, to which I would respond by gazing at my toes and grunting.
